Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice with cul; white slip; interior: glazed black; single added red band between two added white bands on cul; exterior: painted decoration consisting of sphinx or lion to left (part of body with dotted stripe and red patch on side, one foreleg and one hind leg remaining); two lines in dilute glaze below; on cul, double saw-edged metope pattern in two rows with group of six vertical lines on left; below, brown band.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding the metope pattern, see Lemos, no. 952 from Thessaloniki, Ayia Paraskevi.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0961) (phase 2)
